sub_topic: Calculation of Carnot efficiency of a heat engine
message_1: A Carnot engine operates between a hot reservoir at 800 K and a cold reservoir at 300 K. If the engine outputs 200 J of work for every 400 J of heat it takes in from the hot reservoir, what is the Carnot efficiency of the engine?
message_2:
The Carnot efficiency is the maximum efficiency that a heat engine can achieve when operating between two reservoirs at different temperatures. It is given by the formula:

Carnot efficiency = 1 - (T_cold / T_hot)

where T_cold is the temperature of the cold reservoir and T_hot is the temperature of the hot reservoir. In this case, T_cold = 300 K and T_hot = 800 K.

Carnot efficiency = 1 - (300 K / 800 K)
Carnot efficiency = 1 - 0.375
Carnot efficiency = 0.625 or 62.5%

The Carnot efficiency of the engine is 62.5%.
